exam.question: On weekends my grandma usually ______ a glass of wine.

answer.explain: 句意： 我的祖母在周末常常会畅饮一杯。subscribe to： 订阅； engage in： 从事， 忙于； hang on： 紧握不放； 坚持下去。

sentences.sContent: Only rarely will she indulge in a glass of wine.
sentences.sCn: 她只是偶尔才会喝上杯葡萄酒。

sentences.sContent: He returned to Ohio so that he could indulge his passion for football.
sentences.sCn: 他重返俄亥俄以释放自己对足球的激情。

sentences.sContent: ...should not indulge themselves in computer games...

synos.tran: 满足；纵容；使高兴；使沉迷于…

remMethod.val: “一打急” → 太纵容孩子， 结果一打就急 → 纵容， 迁就

trans.tranCn: 沉溺， 纵容自己， 肆意从事
trans.tranOther: If you indulge in something or if you indulge yourself, you allow yourself to have or do something that you know you will enjoy

trans.tranCn: 使沉溺于，满足；纵容，迁就
trans.tranOther: to let someone have or do whatever they want, even if it is bad for them
